subject: Art
title: Color Mood Boards
description: Collecting and curating color palettes for creative projects.

hook.text: Before a movie is filmed, the art department creates a color mood board â€” photos, fabric swatches, paint chips â€” all curating the palette that will define the film's visual identity.

buildup.text: A color mood board gathers inspiration: photographs, artwork, nature shots, fabric patterns, screenshots â€” anything that captures the color feeling you want. Then you extract 5-7 key colors.

discovery.text: Tools like Adobe Color, Coolors, and even the eyedropper in Photoshop let you sample colors directly from inspirational images. Pull 5 swatches and you have a working palette in seconds.

twist.text: The best palettes include variety in value and saturation, not just hue. Five bright, saturated colors at the same value is overwhelming. Mix lights, darks, vivid accents, and muted neutrals.

climax.text: Create a mood board for your next project: collect 10 images that capture the feeling, extract colors, and narrow to 5-7 colors. That palette IS your project's visual DNA.

punchline.text: Great palettes aren't invented. They're discovered â€” through observation, collection, and curation.

quiz.question: What makes a color palette effective for a project?
options: Using as many colors as possible
Including variety in value and saturation, not just hue
Matching every color exactly to a brand
